reviewText: A lot of hard work. I just simply fail to understand that why in the whole world they love to put the Iranis that hate Americans on such DVDs? Why?
I rated it highly because it is my understanding that it is very close to actuality & historically very much in my lifetime.
This video is an excellent companion piece to Mark Bowden's in depth book on the Iranian Hostage Crisis.

This documentary is very well done.  It give the viewer an inside look into the Iranian Hostage Crisis.  It includes interviews with the author, Mark Bowden, who wrote the book"Guests of the Ayatollah", and has written other outstanding books including "Black Hawk Down", and "Killing Pablo".  This documentary also included interviews with many of the actual hostages, and it shares their stories, as well as interview with some of the hostage takers.  It gives an in-depth view of the conflict from the roots of the tensions that led to the hostage crisis to it's aftermath.

This program was better than I expected. I was glued to my seat for the entire 4 hours. The re-enactments and interviews almost put you right there in Tehran in 1979 & 1980. The program that I thought was the most interesting of all was the episode about the rescue mission. This episode alone is worth the entire amount. The vintage footage was also very good along with the commentaries from the author, hostages, hostage takers, and military members.
